text: upright Checking the radio transmitter tower, 1930 Königs Wusterhausen coat of arms Königs Wusterhausen Central Tower was a , free standing steel framework tower on the Funkerberg of Königs Wusterhausen, Germany. The tower, with its unique triangular cross section, was built from 1924 to 1925 and was to have a 40-meter high shortwave aerial on top which would have brought it to a height of 283 meters, . The tower collapsed during the storm Quimburga on 13 November 1972. ==See also== * List of towers ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Communication towers in Germany Category:Dahme-Spreewald
title: Königs Wusterhausen Central Tower
